ticket.title: `rails server unicorn`
ticket.original-body:
Unicorn is a new Rack-aware Web server / application container.
We can run Rails on Unicorn in development mode via invoking the `unicorn` or `unicorn -p 3000` command (or `unicorn_rails` and `unicorn_rails -p 3000`).
But `rails server #{server}` has some extra sauce that adds Rack middleware that tails `log/development.log` to `stdout`. This is missing when invoking unicorn directly.
Please add `unicorn` to the list of Web servers recognized by Rails in the `rails server #{server}` command such that `rails server unicorn` launches the Rails application in development mode on port 3000, with `log/development.log` tailed to `stdout`.

version.body:
This isn't something that Rails maintains. When you run `rails server mongrel`, or `rails server thin` it's Rack that handles the server argument.
Rack ships with handlers for mongrel, thin, Webrick, and a few others. Other servers (like Unicorn) include Rack handlers in their own codebase. But like you said Unicorn's handler doesn't set the same options that rails does by default. But I don't think you'll see this added to Rails.
I wrote a simple gem just for this use case (https://github.com/jstorimer/hooves).
